channel.title: Systemd on timerring
channel.description: Recent content in Systemd on timerring

item.title: About the Systemd
item.description: It has been a long time since the linux used init to manage the startup process, such as sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 start or service apache2 start, but the init is serial. To address this issue, the systemd was born. The d is the abbreviation of daemon, which means the systemd is a daemon manager. The systemd substitutes the initd and becomes the default main process PID 1.

item.title: Docker 101
item.description: Docker is a practical tool for everyday use, and like Git, you can learn it in just 30 minutes.
